abstracts.cdata!:
This evaluation report rates the outcome
            of the China Inland Waterways Project as satisfactory, with
            likely sustainability, substantial institutional development
            impact, and satisfactory Bank and Borrower performances.
            These lessons were cited: Inland waterways is an efficient
            and environmentally-friendly transport mode for conveying
            bulk goods when the market demand is strong and such
            projects are developed in coordination with the other modes
            o f transportation. Additional benefits flow from using dams
            that deepen water channels to generate hydro-electric power.
            It is important to thoroughly assess both the market and the
            risks realized from traffic forecasts and monitoring
            indicators during project preparation. Inland waterway
            projects should consider including guidelines to encourage
            and expedite shipping modernization to help ensure that
            vessel fleet efficiency keeps pace with service levels
            provided by improving the infrastructure.
